posts._title: Mehrdad Oskouei – Az pase borghe AKA The Other Side of the Burka (2004)
posts.title: Az pase borghe
posts.excerpt: Set in a tight-knit, extremely conservative island community off the Southern coast of Iran where all women wear burkas, this film begins as an investigation into the suicide of a woman named Samireh. Her husband callously says that while he cares about the lives of his kids, women’s lives are cheap. However, the women the …
posts.titleEnglish: The Other Side of the Burka

posts._title: Roman Polanski – Gdy spadaja anioly AKA When Angels Fall (1959)
posts.title: Gdy spadaja anioly
posts.excerpt: Quote:A woman working in the municipal toilet recalls her youth. Colourful images of life in the countryside, first love, lancers intertwine with a gloomy image of reality. The film is the diploma work by Roman Polański.

posts._title: Yoshishige Yoshida – Arashi ga oka aka Wuthering Heights (1988)
posts.title: Arashi ga oka
posts.excerpt: This erotic and violent story taken from Emily Bronte’s classic novel, and Georges Bataille’s analyzes, takes place in medieval Japan instead of 19th-century Yorkshire. Onimaru (Yasaku Matsuda) is an orphan boy taken in by a group of priests who worship the Mountain Of Fire and try to appease the gods of anger. He loves Kinu …

posts.title: Adauchi
posts.excerpt: Quote: This tragic drama shows a young man fettered by Bushido, the way of the Samurai, who tried to escape the chains of his position, but was being forced to die. When the Tokugawa Shogunate ruled the land, Tatsuno castle in Wakisaka Clan’s home of Harima held an established custom, the inspection of the arms …

posts._title: Michel Lemoine – L’amour aux sports d’hiver (1981)
posts.title: L’amour aux sports d’hiver
posts.excerpt: Imdb:Alice, a shy girl joins Gabrielle Pontrello and some horny friends for hot fun on a chatelet in the French alps. Hot sex scenes and nice other girls.

posts._title: Raoul Ruiz – Nadie Dijo Nada aka Nobody Said Anything (1972)
posts.title: Nadie Dijo Nada
posts.excerpt: “With this film I returned to the world of Tres tristes tigres, to some people, in this case writers, who live in their own reality and believe that it is, in fact, Chile.” Raul Ruiz

posts._title: Peter Watkins – Fritänkaren aka The Freethinker (1994)
posts.title: Fritänkaren
posts.excerpt: Quote:“This is Peter Watkins (epic) companion-piece to his highly acclaimed “Edvard Munch” (1974). “The Freethinker” examines the life, art, and times of the noted Swedish dramatist August Strindberg, author of Miss Julie, Inferno, and Dance of Death. Strindberg is depicted as a rebel, and idealistic and controversial iconoclast who openly criticized the hypocrisy of 19th …

posts.title: Narazu-mono
posts.excerpt: Intrigue and mystery surround a cold-hearted assassin who must keep one step ahead of the Hong Kong police as he tries to find out who framed him for the murder of a woman and set him up as the fall guy in a complicated drug scheme. Starring Takakura Ken as Nanjo the assassin and directed …

posts._title: Luís Filipe Rocha – Cinzento e Negro AKA Grey and Black (2015)
posts.title: Cinzento e Negro
posts.excerpt: Quote:Cinzento e Negro tells the story of David, who steals a lot of money from an old man and escapes to the Azores, where he begins a new life and falls in love with a lonesome local woman named Marina. But no crime goes without punishment, and the couple will soon be chased by a …

posts.title: Chien
posts.excerpt: Jacques Blanchot loses everything: his wife, his home, his job. He gradually alienates himself from the world around him. Until the day when the owner of a pet shop takes him in.
